flavor: "While there have been other anti-corporation movements before, like the Maroon Wave, this new one is different. It's organized." -Ramesh Gupta, One World Economy
printed_text: Make a run. When the run ends, trash 1 piece of ice that was rezzed during this run.
stripped_printed_text: Make a run. When the run ends, trash 1 piece of ice that was rezzed during this run.

printed_text:
[trash]: Prevent up to X net or brain damage. Trash cards from the top of your stack equal to the amount of damage prevented. X is the number of copies of Ramujan-reliant 550 BMI installed (including the one just trashed).
Limit 6 per deck.
stripped_printed_text: trash: Prevent up to X net or brain damage. Trash cards from the top of your stack equal to the amount of damage prevented. X is the number of copies of Ramujan-reliant 550 BMI installed (including the one just trashed). Limit 6 per deck.

flavor: The greatest trick is not the trick itself, but in making someone believe that it is no trick at all. To your average sysop, it's magic. To your average runner, it's a closely held trade secret.
printed_text: Unbroken subroutines resolve in the order of your choice.
stripped_printed_text: Unbroken subroutines resolve in the order of your choice.

printed_text: Make a run on a server with at least 1 piece of unrezzed ice. When the run ends, gain 12[credit] if it was successful.
stripped_printed_text: Make a run on a server with at least 1 piece of unrezzed ice. When the run ends, gain 12 credits if it was successful.

flavor: It is the hardest thing in the world to frighten a mongoose, because he is eaten up from nose to tail with curiosity. The motto of all the mongoose family is "Run and find out". -Rudyard Kipling, Rikki-Tikki-Tavi
printed_text: You cannot use this program to break subroutines on more than one ice per run. Interface → 1[credit]: Break up to 2 sentry subroutines. 2[credit]: +2 strength.
stripped_printed_text: You cannot use this program to break subroutines on more than one ice per run. Interface -> 1 credit: Break up to 2 sentry subroutines. 2 credits: +2 strength.

printed_text: [interrupt] → The first time each run you would take 1 or more tags, prevent 1 tag.
stripped_printed_text: Interrupt -> The first time each run you would take 1 or more tags, prevent 1 tag.

printed_text: +2[mu] Once per turn, immediately after you access a card from R&D, you may add that card to the bottom of R&D. If you do, take 1 tag. Limit 1 console per player.
stripped_printed_text: +2 mu Once per turn, immediately after you access a card from R&D, you may add that card to the bottom of R&D. If you do, take 1 tag. Limit 1 console per player.

flavor: "The basics should be like the stories you learned as a child—unconscious, never forgotten, and suddenly relevant at the most random times." -g00ru
printed_text: Once per turn, when you encounter a piece of ice, you may have it gain 1 subtype of your choice that is not sentry, code gate, or barrier for the remainder of this run.
stripped_printed_text: Once per turn, when you encounter a piece of ice, you may have it gain 1 subtype of your choice that is not sentry, code gate, or barrier for the remainder of this run.

flavor: "We can forgive a man for making a useful thing as long as he does not admire it. The only excuse for making a useless thing is that one admires it intensely." -Oscar Wilde
printed_text: Forfeit 1 agenda: Search your stack for 1 program, resource, or piece of hardware. Install that card.
stripped_printed_text: Forfeit 1 agenda: Search your stack for 1 program, resource, or piece of hardware. Install that card.

flavor: Legions of software engineers have been manufactured within its halls.
printed_text:
[click]: Place 1 power counter on Chatterjee University.
[click]: Install a program from your grip, lowering the install cost by 1 for each power counter on Chatterjee University. Remove 1 hosted power counter.
stripped_printed_text: click: Place 1 power counter on Chatterjee University. click: Install a program from your grip, lowering the install cost by 1 for each power counter on Chatterjee University. Remove 1 hosted power counter.

flavor: "I don't want a hopper. I've never even owned one. But every time I jack in, that same damn ad loads." -2xTiger
printed_text: The first time the Runner initiates a run each turn, you may draw 1 card or gain 1[credit].
stripped_printed_text: The first time the Runner initiates a run each turn, you may draw 1 card or gain 1 credit.

printed_text: Lose [click]: Break 1 subroutine on this ice. Only the Runner can use this ability. [subroutine] The Runner cannot use programs for the remainder of this run. [subroutine] Trace[4]. If successful, do 1 brain damage. [subroutine] Trace[4]. If successful, do 1 brain damage.
stripped_printed_text: Lose click: Break 1 subroutine on this ice. Only the Runner can use this ability. Subroutine The Runner cannot use programs for the remainder of this run. Subroutine Trace[4]. If successful, do 1 brain damage. Subroutine Trace[4]. If successful, do 1 brain damage.

flavor: It is only by respecting the past that we can build a better future.
printed_text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [jinteki] cards in your deck. Draw 3 cards. Add 1 card from HQ to the top of R&D.
stripped_printed_text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance jinteki cards in your deck. Draw 3 cards. Add 1 card from HQ to the top of R&D.

printed_text: Whenever the Runner passes a piece of ice protecting this server, you may swap that ice with another piece of ice protecting this server. Limit 1 region per server.
stripped_printed_text: Whenever the Runner passes a piece of ice protecting this server, you may swap that ice with another piece of ice protecting this server. Limit 1 region per server.

flavor: "A new property has two, maybe three hours. If it doesn't sell, cut it and move on."
printed_text:
When your turn begins, you may look at the top card of the Runner's stack.
[trash]: The Runner trashes the top card of his or her stack.
stripped_printed_text: When your turn begins, you may look at the top card of the Runner's stack. trash: The Runner trashes the top card of his or her stack.

printed_text: [subroutine] For the remainder of this run, the Runner must pay 1[credit] as an additional cost each time he or she uses an icebreaker to break at least 1 subroutine. [subroutine] For the remainder of this run, the Runner must pay 1[credit] as an additional cost each time he or she uses an icebreaker to break at least 1 subroutine.
stripped_printed_text: Subroutine For the remainder of this run, the Runner must pay 1 credit as an additional cost each time he or she uses an icebreaker to break at least 1 subroutine. Subroutine For the remainder of this run, the Runner must pay 1 credit as an additional cost each time he or she uses an icebreaker to break at least 1 subroutine.

flavor: "Never cut the ribbon until you have something to show off." -Eta Shah, VP Global Expansion
printed_text: Place 3 advancement tokens on a faceup card. You cannot score that card until your next turn begins.
stripped_printed_text: Place 3 advancement tokens on a faceup card. You cannot score that card until your next turn begins.

flavor: Those who are the wisest know the least.
printed_text:
This card costs 0 influence if you have 15 or fewer ice in your deck.
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to rez cards.
stripped_printed_text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 15 or fewer ice in your deck. 2 recurring credits Use these credits to rez cards.

flavor: "And here we see the Polar Bear, once the largest land carnivore on Earth."
printed_text:
This card costs 0 influence if you have 50 or more cards in your deck.
When your turn begins, you may shuffle 1 card from Archives into R&D.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.1</errata>
stripped_printed_text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 50 or more cards in your deck. When your turn begins, you may shuffle 1 card from Archives into R&D. Errata from FAQ 3.1
